data.Headline: In Trump Company Trial, Each Side Finds a Villain
data.Abstract: In a case that centers on tax law, defense lawyers blame the company’s former chief financial officer. Prosecutors bring up the former president.

data.Headline: A Host of Tech Companies Announce Hiring Freezes and Job Cuts
data.Abstract: Amazon said it was pausing corporate hiring, while Lyft and Stripe said they were cutting jobs.

data.Headline: ‘Christian Girl Autumn’ Goes Back to Basic
data.Abstract: Caitlin Covington became a meme in 2019 for her love of fall. Three years later, she’s leaning into it harder than ever.

data.Headline: Reassessing Ben Bernanke’s Record
data.Abstract: After winning the Nobel prize for economics, the former Federal Reserve chairman’s record on the economy is getting further scrutiny.

data.Headline: Michelle Williams
data.Abstract: No actor working today has evoked the tragedy and pathos of the leading lady — and brought those qualities to her art — as deeply as Williams. Now she’s figuring out how to fuel that same creativity from a very different place.

data.Headline: Tech’s Talent Wars Have Come Back to Bite It
data.Abstract: Hiring the best, the brightest and the highest number of employees was a badge of honor at tech companies. Not anymore as layoffs surge.

data.Headline: As Fox and News Corp Weigh Merger, an Activist Has Its Own Vision
data.Abstract: Irenic Capital Management, which has a $150 million stake in News Corp, wants the company to split up its media and real estate listings businesses.

data.Headline: A New Push for Business to Help Pay for Climate-Change Solutions
data.Abstract: As global leaders gather at COP27, efforts are reportedly underway to have companies help shoulder the financial burden.

data.Headline: Losses Pile Up in FTX Bankruptcy Turmoil
data.Abstract: The crypto exchange’s founder, Sam Bankman-Fried, says the company suffered a $51 billon collapse in collateral, but he thinks filing for Chapter 11 was a mistake.

data.Headline: Was This $100 Billion Deal the Worst Merger Ever?
data.Abstract: At Time Warner, executives saw AT&T as just a “big phone company from Texas.” At AT&T, they thought Hollywood would play by their rules. That combination led to strategic miscalculation unrivaled in recent corporate history.

data.Headline: Was This $100 Billion Deal the Worst Merger Ever?

data.Headline: He’s an Outspoken Defender of Meat. Industry Funds His Research, Files Show.
data.Abstract: A UC Davis professor runs an academic center that was conceived by a trade group, according to records, and gets most of its funding from farming interests.

data.Headline: N.Y.U. Putting $1 Billion Into Its Engineering School in Brooklyn
data.Abstract: The university is seeking to improve its ranking among competitors and raise New York City’s profile in the technology sector.

data.Headline: China’s Covid Contagion
data.Abstract: Stock markets in Asia and Europe fell on Monday, as did U.S. futures and crude prices, as investors worried about the fallout of social unrest in China.

data.Headline: As Dinosaur Fossils Fetch Millions, There’s Many a Bone to Pick
data.Abstract: Fossils are a multimillion-dollar business, bringing legal disputes, nondisclosure agreements and trademarks to the world of paleontology.

data.Headline: Ryan Murphy Is Having a Very Happy Halloween
data.Abstract: After a few up-and-down years at Netflix, the gatekeeper of horror now has the two biggest shows on the streamer.

data.Headline: An Anti-Muslim Symbol From India Is Paraded on Main Street, New Jersey
data.Abstract: Bulldozers have become symbols of oppression in India. The appearance of a wheel loader, which resembles a bulldozer, in a New Jersey parade has exposed fault lines in the region.
